column5: Took a gamble fishing the largest lake in Ontario in October. Got lucky! Low wind and 50 to 60 deg. Temps. Started shallow and only found small Pike. Great for the frying pan but I was looking for some trophy’s. We decided to try rocks, same. Deep weeds, Bingo! The further of shore the better. Found a cabage and coontail bed on a huge Sand flat 200 yards off shore during a good wind and got 5 over 40 biggest 47. IMG_3220.jpg IMG_3260.jpg IMG_3226.jpg IMG_3247.jpg

Also marked some huge schools of bait off deep rock points. Thought we would find some monsters. Wrong. Got a couple 30 inchers and some trout. Beautiful fish but season closed. All still swimming. Trout and Pike IMG_3269.jpg IMG_9192.png
Nipigon? Not sure but that’s some good fishing. Congrats
Those Pike had to be a blast!! FDR
Way 2 go lil’ door  . Did you go out of pasha? Everyone knows thats the best place for the big nip DSCN1575.jpg DSCN1560.jpg DSCN1577.jpg DSC_0075.jpeg
